class.name: Projection
class.description: A 4×4 matrix used for 3D projective transformations. It can represent transformations such as translation, rotation, scaling, shearing, and perspective division. It consists of four [Vector4] columns. For purely linear transformations (translation, rotation, and scale), it is recommended to use [Transform3D], as it is more performant and requires less memory. Used internally as [Camera3D]'s projection matrix.

constructor.name: Projection
constructor.description: Constructs a default-initialized [Projection] identical to [constant IDENTITY]. [b]Note:[/b] In C#, this constructs a [Projection] identical to [constant ZERO].

constructor.name: Projection
constructor.description: Constructs a [Projection] as a copy of the given [Projection].

constructor.name: Projection
constructor.description: Constructs a Projection as a copy of the given [Transform3D].

constructor.name: Projection
constructor.description: Constructs a Projection from four [Vector4] values (matrix columns).

method.name: create_depth_correction
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions from a depth range of [code]-1[/code] to [code]1[/code] to one that ranges from [code]0[/code] to [code]1[/code], and flips the projected positions vertically, according to [param flip_y].

method.name: create_fit_aabb
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that scales a given projection to fit around a given [AABB] in projection space.

method.name: create_for_hmd
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] for projecting positions onto a head-mounted display with the given X:Y aspect ratio, distance between eyes, display width, distance to lens, oversampling factor, and depth clipping planes. [param eye] creates the projection for the left eye when set to 1, or the right eye when set to 2.

method.name: create_frustum
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions in a frustum with the given clipping planes.

method.name: create_frustum_aspect
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions in a frustum with the given size, X:Y aspect ratio, offset, and clipping planes. [param flip_fov] determines whether the projection's field of view is flipped over its diagonal.

method.name: create_light_atlas_rect
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions into the given [Rect2].

method.name: create_orthogonal
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions using an orthogonal projection with the given clipping planes.

method.name: create_orthogonal_aspect
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions using an orthogonal projection with the given size, X:Y aspect ratio, and clipping planes. [param flip_fov] determines whether the projection's field of view is flipped over its diagonal.

method.name: create_perspective
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions using a perspective projection with the given Y-axis field of view (in degrees), X:Y aspect ratio, and clipping planes. [param flip_fov] determines whether the projection's field of view is flipped over its diagonal.

method.name: create_perspective_hmd
method.description: Creates a new [Projection] that projects positions using a perspective projection with the given Y-axis field of view (in degrees), X:Y aspect ratio, and clipping distances. The projection is adjusted for a head-mounted display with the given distance between eyes and distance to a point that can be focused on. [param eye] creates the projection for the left eye when set to 1, or the right eye when set to 2. [param flip_fov] determines whether the projection's field of view is flipped over its diagonal.

method.name: determinant
method.description: Returns a scalar value that is the signed factor by which areas are scaled by this matrix. If the sign is negative, the matrix flips the orientation of the area. The determinant can be used to calculate the invertibility of a matrix or solve linear systems of equations involving the matrix, among other applications.

method.name: flipped_y
method.description: Returns a copy of this [Projection] with the signs of the values of the Y column flipped.

method.name: get_aspect
method.description: Returns the X:Y aspect ratio of this [Projection]'s viewport.

method.name: get_far_plane_half_extents
method.description: Returns the dimensions of the far clipping plane of the projection, divided by two.

method.name: get_fov
method.description: Returns the horizontal field of view of the projection (in degrees).

method.name: get_fovy
method.description: Returns the vertical field of view of the projection (in degrees) associated with the given horizontal field of view (in degrees) and aspect ratio. [b]Note:[/b] Unlike most methods of [Projection], [param aspect] is expected to be 1 divided by the X:Y aspect ratio.

method.name: get_lod_multiplier
method.description: Returns the factor by which the visible level of detail is scaled by this [Projection].

method.name: get_pixels_per_meter
method.description: Returns [param for_pixel_width] divided by the viewport's width measured in meters on the near plane, after this [Projection] is applied.

method.name: get_projection_plane
method.description: Returns the clipping plane of this [Projection] whose index is given by [param plane]. [param plane] should be equal to one of [constant PLANE_NEAR], [constant PLANE_FAR], [constant PLANE_LEFT], [constant PLANE_TOP], [constant PLANE_RIGHT], or [constant PLANE_BOTTOM].

method.name: get_viewport_half_extents
method.description: Returns the dimensions of the viewport plane that this [Projection] projects positions onto, divided by two.

method.name: get_z_far
method.description: Returns the distance for this [Projection] beyond which positions are clipped.

method.name: get_z_near
method.description: Returns the distance for this [Projection] before which positions are clipped.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns a [Projection] that performs the inverse of this [Projection]'s projective transformation.

method.name: is_frustum_symmetric
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Projection] conforms to standard orthographic or perspective.

method.name: is_orthogonal
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Projection] performs an orthogonal projection.

method.name: jitter_offseted
method.description: Returns a [Projection] with the X and Y values from the given [Vector2] added to the first and second values of the final column respectively.

method.name: perspective_znear_adjusted
method.description: Returns a [Projection] with the near clipping distance adjusted to be [param new_znear]. [b]Note:[/b] The original [Projection] must be a perspective projection.

members.member: The projection matrix's W vector (column 3). Equivalent to array index [code]3[/code].

The projection matrix's Z vector (column 2). Equivalent to array index [code]2[/code].

operator.name: operator !=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the projections are not equal. [b]Note:[/b] Due to floating-point precision errors, this may return [code]true[/code], even if the projections are virtually equal. An [code]is_equal_approx[/code] method may be added in a future version of Godot.

operator.name: operator *
operator.description: Returns a [Projection] that applies the combined transformations of this [Projection] and [param right].

operator.name: operator *
operator.description: Projects (multiplies) the given [Vector4] by this [Projection] matrix.

operator.name: operator ==
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the projections are equal. [b]Note:[/b] Due to floating-point precision errors, this may return [code]false[/code], even if the projections are virtually equal. An [code]is_equal_approx[/code] method may be added in a future version of Godot.

operator.name: operator []
operator.description: Returns the column of the [Projection] with the given index. Indices are in the following order: x, y, z, w.
